t: To the choirmaster. A Psalm of the Sons of Korah.
Lord,*spn you were favorable to your land; you*ld restored the fortunes of Jacob.
You*ln forgave the iniquity of your people; you*ld covered all their sin. Selah*ig
You*ln withdrew all your wrath; you*ld turned from your hot anger.
Restore*pn us again, O God of our salvation, and*ld put away your indignation toward us!
Will*ln you be angry with us forever? Will*ld you prolong your anger to all generations?
Will*ln you not revive us again, that*ld your people may rejoice in you?
Show*ln us your steadfast love, O Lord,*s and*ld grant us your salvation.
Let*pn me hear what God the Lord*s will speak, for*ld he will speak peace to his people, to his saints; but*ld let them not turn back to folly.
Surely*ln his salvation is near to those who fear him, that*ld glory may dwell in our land.
Steadfast*pn love and faithfulness meet; righteousness*ld and peace kiss each other.
Faithfulness*ln springs up from the ground, and*ld righteousness looks down from the sky.
Yes,*ln the Lord*s will give what is good, and*ld our land will yield its increase.
Righteousness*ln will go before him and*ld make his footsteps a way.
